title: How do you be great without Freedom is Speech?

replies.body:
From [Ulanaopo's Knowledge Base](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4086541&page=1#post43465469): 

>**Freedom of Speech!!!!!**

>Doesnt apply. No really. If were talking about American law, the First Amendment only applies to the government making laws that prohibit speech and, even then, freedom of speech isnt absolute. For example, you cant incite a riot, plan to kill the president or yell fire in a crowded theater.

>Also, theres nothing in the First Amendment that protects you from the consequences of your speech. People are fired all the time for making derogatory comments about their employer. My workplace, for example, has a social media policy that says that I can be terminated for badmouthing the company. They dont ask for passwords and access as some companies have been known to do, but it wouldnt be all that difficult to find me on the internet, knowing my real name, phone number and address.
You missed the point of the OP. He's saying things would be better without speech oppression.

> [{quoted}](name=Nightsky Pirate,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=PyxFUTOh,comment-id=00060000,timestamp=2019-11-08T04:01:35.230+0000)
>
> You missed the point of the OP. He's saying things would be better without speech oppression.

No point was missed: the OP is just another person who wants to be able to say and do whatever they want without fear of repercussions or accountability and thinks that freedom of speech allows or should allow for just that when it clearly doesn't or shouldn't.

Why should it be considered acceptable for someone to verbally abuse and harass others, call them racial slurs or tell them to end their life or things like that? What's wrong with expecting people to be civil and mature and respectful when interacting with others and holding them accountable for it if/when they're not?

The OP had nothing to say about any of the 2nd paragraph. 

You're skipping ahead to the points of these things being a problem if speech were not oppressed. This is a conundrum, though, isn't it? You believe that the system is properly and effectively correcting disrespectful and rude behavior. I believe otherwise, but this is not a popular opinion on THIS forum. Perhaps others as well. This would be a lengthy discussion, but outside the scope of the OP.

*edit* about the first paragraph- based on his other statements, I don't think that's correct.

> [{quoted}](name=Nightsky Pirate,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=PyxFUTOh,comment-id=0006000000010000,timestamp=2019-11-08T04:18:23.736+0000)
>
> The OP had nothing to say about any of the 2nd paragraph. 
> 
> You're skipping ahead to the points of these things being a problem if speech were not oppressed. This is a conundrum, though, isn't it? You believe that the system is properly and effectively correcting disrespectful and rude behavior. I believe otherwise, but this is not a popular opinion on THIS forum. Perhaps others as well. This would be a lengthy discussion, but outside the scope of the OP.

I'm well aware that the system is not perfect and needs work (especially in the troll and inter detecting department), and am also well aware of the fact that some people just don't care about rules. That said it's better than nothing.

> *edit* about the first paragraph- based on his other statements, I don't think that's correct.

My first paragraph in my original post here is the impression I got from their statements, and I feel they're trying to be clever and sneaky about how they go about presenting that viewpoint but are doing a poor job of doing so.

At no point did he say *anything* along the lines of "I deserve Freedom of Speech". He plainly said, "How do you be great without Freedom is Speech?" Everyone else is inserting the extra meaning. Even you. And he called them dumb for it. He's correct.

He alluded to freedom of speech by saying "freedom is speech", but his point is direct. His responses were the same vein- like a patriot he defends freedom of speech, but it is immediately proceeded by stating that was a disjuncture from his point.

EVEN IF he is simply being a clever troll by this weak point that freedom of speech should apply to League, it's far more respectful of his intelligence to NOT make that assumption.

Rather, how do you say, "You people are being oppressive?"

This seems a nicer, more lighthearted way of doing it. He's nice. I'm blunt.

>He plainly said, "How do you be great without Freedom is Speech?" 

and he followed it up with "you can't" 

aka "you can't be great without freedom of speech"

in the future try less selective reading and more **actual reading**
and he's dead wrong
I agree. Yet the moderator's response didn't REALLY have anything to do with the OP.
considering the OP's body had 2 words in it i would say yeah it did, vague title with Free speech in it warrants a free speech reply no?
I expect he said "Freedom *is* Speech" on purpose.
i expect that was a typo
Would you go to a movie theater more often or less often if the other customers were using their "freedom of speech" during the movies?
Everyone is allowed to use freedom is speech in a movie theatre. The theatre simply asks you to not speak loudly. If you could mute somebody, I'm sure they wouldn't even do that much.

what a bunch of bull. if you go into your local theater and start yelling the N word, they aren't going to tell you to please lower your racism to an acceptable volume. No, they will kick you the fuck out and are well within their rights to do so
I just want to point out, racism is legal.
All that means is a cop isn't likely to arrest you. The business can still tell you to leave their establishment though.

You get a gold star!

And if anyone does anything illegal to the man saying racist things, that man may be entitled to seek *legal justice*.
And how is that relevant? Nobody is doing anything illegal to the man saying racist things, and nobody is doing anything illegal to people who flame in LoL.
Hey, Imperial Pandaa called the cops, not me.

Which makes sense, because it helps enforcing that somebody actually leaves.
Racism might not be illegal, but trespassing is.

Good to see we all *so clearly* understand the law. I'll just get my jacket then... Oh wait, I'm not being racist. He was responding to someone who thought Durooooo was suggesting Freedom of Speech would allow him to chatterbox away in a movie theater, and Durooooo politely pointed out that Freedom of Speech is, in fact, not suppressed in movie theaters. Then when confronted by a man blatantly exaggerating the point that Freedom of Speech doesn't allow people to yell N* a movie theater, he once again politely points out that racism is not illegal.

At no point does he suggest that anyone is entitled to do such things.

But that's the thing: If OP believes freedom of speech is not suppressed in movie theatres then by the same logic it's also not suppressed in LoL.
If it is suppressed in LoL, then by the same logic it is suppressed in movie theatres.

Pointing out that racism is legal, no matter how polite, is a red herring. Not only does it not have any relevance to the subject, it distracts from it.

Is that so...? LoL and a movie theater are two very different beasts when it comes to talking etiquette. It is constantly said on this forum, the punishments and the flags for them are too harsh. How often is that said of movie theaters kicking people out?

Additionally, people not talking in theaters at all is a boon, but it is not in LoL. Suppression of chat, both literally and as an encouraged behavior result of harsh example setting, is perhaps not the best answer.

Part of this is saying that the whole idea of **F**reedom of **S**peech giving people a sense of entitlement to say whatever is also a direction this shouldn't be going. How dare he say Freedom is Speech.

It is constantly said **by a very small number of people who can’t follow the rules**.

Riot is going to listen to and make the game appealing to the 80% of players who can follow the rules and never get a single punishment, not the 0.006% who get permanently banned.

Chat isn’t being suppressed in League. Only **toxic** chat. Which is called toxic, by the way, because it literally makes the game harder if not impossible to win, *and* causes lots of frustration in teammates as a result. So, how would allowing toxic chat make the game better?
{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}
Duroooo is spot on, ya'll are just feeling entitled to being treated nicely.
*edit* replied to the wrong person, my bad

i dont think that at all, read literally any of my other comments

see edit

I watch movies that women and children don't attend, so I don't have that problem. 
I went to see Darkest Hour and Dunkirk in the theatre and both times there were only 5 or 6 other old men in there.

No one has this problem. If anyone did encounter this, the movie theater has the right to remove patrons from the premises.

"Remove" is not exactly the word. A representative of the property owner (like an employee) can rescind permission to be on the property. At this point, most patrons leave. If they don't leave, it becomes trespassing, so the police can be called to enforce the actual removal.

dude...dont bark up the 'freedom of speech' tree

it's not the hill you want to die on
Have no idea what you mean by this, but I will advocate for freedom of speech until the day I die.
it means you probably shouldn't "advocate" for something you seem to not know very much about...

I am not allowed to walk into your living room and say whatever I want. If I don't follow the rules of your house, you are allowed to remove me.

League of Legends is Riot's living room. They get to make the rules, including the code of conduct that we all have to adhere to in order to keep our accounts in good standing.

You want a place where people can say whatever they want, feel free to make your own game.
I understand what you're trying to say, but you're wrong.

holy crap...

maybe you should tell us then.

can you define free speech for all of us please?
"I want to do whatever I want with no repercussions."

I expect that if I come into your house for a sleepover or whatever, then start making a loud ruckus (similar to that meme with the girl banging pots/pans outside peoples' doors) while you're trying to sleep, you'll let me do that then, right?

Freedom of speech, right?

> [{quoted}](name=Durooooo,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=PyxFUTOh,comment-id=000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2019-11-08T00:39:11.536+0000)
>
> You're simply responding out of emotion trying to avoid reality. Bottom line is freedom of speech is beautiful and you're allowed to have stupid opinions.

Just as Riot is allowed to deny service and moderate their game. Freedom of speech was never infringed on because it never applied.

> [{quoted}](name=Durooooo,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=PyxFUTOh,comment-id=000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2019-11-08T00:39:11.536+0000)
>
> you're allowed to have stupid opinions.


case in point huh?

im not sure you know what reality is
Cool, can you show me where was your right to "freedom of speech" violated? :O

Most of the people ranting about freedom of speech are just trying to make it acceptable to be an asshole again. 

Nobody wants you. Go away.

Nobody is oppressing you. You're the one trying to oppress others.

"Nobody is oppressing you." -commentary to a probable chat restricted recipient

Assuming he is chat restricted, he is being silenced. I'm sure you understand that is oppressive. In an effort to be correctional, yes, but it remains oppressive. When a child hits a younger sibling, do you handcuff their hands so they cannot do so again? I'm trying to open your eyes to the suffering you are causing. Bravo for helping, but please tone it down.

getting punished for breaking rules **THAT YOU AGREED TO IN THE FIRST PLACE** is not oppressive. at all.

>When a child hits a younger sibling, do you handcuff their hands so they cannot do so again?

if you told the child ahead of time that would be the consequence then yes.

Ah, of course, we agreed that it's totally cool to have privileges taken. You know what I see a lot on Player Behavior?

"Suddenly"

Yes, there are liars, but I don't think they're all liars. 5 silenced games isn't that bad of a punishment, right? Without any prior warning that our behavior is out of line, it's a bit uncool. I've been trumpeting that I think the system harsh enough to make people a little placid and afraid of talking. Like as if your rule-lawyer boss were watching every conversation you have.

Hmm.
